Package model

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Line
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Location>
    public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Location>
    A line represents SIZE contiguous locations along a given row, column, or diagonal.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.Iterable<Line> ALL_LINES
      The set of all valid lines
      static int SIZE
      The number of marks in a row required for victory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line​(int r,
            int c,
            int dr,
            int dc)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a line consisting of the locations (r,c), (r+dr, c+dc), (r+2dr, c+2dc), ... Create a Line object consisting of SIZE marks in a line, starting at position (r,c) and moving in direction (dr,dc). In other words, the contains locations (r,c), (r+dr, c+dc), (r+2dr, c+2dc), ..., (r+(SIZE-1)*dr,c+(SIZE-1)*dc).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of these locations are invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if (dr,dc) is (0,0) or |dr| > 1 or |dc| > 1
